data.title: Prince Hassan & Princess Sarvath Current Events 2: September 2005-
data.meta_description: Prince Hassan congratulated today at The Evangelical Lutheran Good Shepherd Church in Amman, Presidents and representatives of the Eastern and Western...
data.text:
Prince Hassan congratulated today at The Evangelical Lutheran Good Shepherd Church in Amman, Presidents and representatives of the Eastern and Western churches and all Jordanian Christians in the Kingdom On Christmas, In the presence of a number of ministers and public figures, Muslims and Christians.

https://www.instagram.com/p/Br3KXz8H17z/

HRH Prince El Hassan bin Talal visited Zaatari camp yesterday. HRH stated that “we should humanize the figures & benefit from the Jordanian response to the Syria crisis, moreover we should look at ways to mobilize social capital to enable & empower those most in need”.

\https://www.facebook.com/HRHPrinceElHassan/photos/pcb.10156940947936575/10156940936846575/?type=3&theater

Prince Hassan of Jordan on Wednesday 2 October met Pope Francis in the Vatican as part of an official visit that will also include Rome and Florence.

Prince Hassan meets Pope | Jordan Times

Prince El Hassan bin Talal, in his new article for The Wilson Center:

“The time has come for a redefining of the conduct of our relations – of our relations with one another...and of our relations with our planet, Earth.”

https://www.wilsoncenter.org/article/civilization-and-its-discontents-price-human-dignity

Prince El Hassan bin Talal, in his new article for The Wilson Center:

“The time has come for a redefining of the conduct of our relations – of our relations with one another...and of our relations with our planet, Earth.”

https://www.wilsoncenter.org/article/civilization-and-its-discontents-price-human-dignity

I found it difficult to understand exactly what propositions the Prince was arguing for in his article.

Prince Hassan attended the launching ceremony of a book titled: “The Frontiers of the Roman Empire - the Eastern Frontiers” prepared by a group of foreign and Arab researchers and archaeologists, with the support of the Embassy of the Netherlands in Jordan. The ceremony take part at the Empassy and attended also Princess Sarvath
